borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed rear dormer window and Juliet balcony, by reason of its mass, bulk and proximity to the neighboring boundaries will generate unacceptable levels of overlooking into the rear gardens of Nos. 20 and 24 Blessing Way. As such the proposed development is contrary to the following:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (2021);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<br></p>

<p>The proposed rear dormer window and Juliet balcony, by reason of its mass, bulk and sitting will appear unduly prominent and represent an unsympathetic addition to the roof of the existing dwellinghouse and the surrounding street scene. As such, the proposed development is contrary to the following:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (2021):</p><p>- Policies D1, D4, D8, of The London Plan (March 2021);</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>
description:
Construction of a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front and a Juliette balcony to facilitate conversion of roof space into
habitable accommodation.
